Articles.Content:
Is there any lightning & storm plugin? If there isn't, can somebody please make one if you can? I've always wanted storms and lightning to be in Kerbal Space Program.

Please Reply!

Thanks!

-CDK

Edited November 4, 2014 by CDK
None yet, but keep an eye on Kerbal Weather Systems, which currently adds wind (requires FAR).

Can somebody try/make one? Plzzzzzzzz?!!

You got an answer. Someone IS Making one. Be patient, these things aren't easy to make...

You got an answer. Someone IS Making one. Be patient, these things aren't easy to make...

Don't worry, I'll be patient . But how long do you estimate it will take?

Edited November 10, 2014 by CDK
Ask the developer, he is in the forum too, you know? Also you could exachenge some "brainstorm", if you catch the pun...

Ask the developer, he is in the forum too, you know? Also you could exachenge some "brainstorm", if you catch the pun...

The thing is, I don't know the developer's KSP Forum name.

Edited November 12, 2014 by CDK

Why not follow the forum thread? You can subscribe to it using the Thread Tools menu near the top right. Then, you can get updates by e-mail or just here on the forum. You can also Follow the mod on Kerbal Stuff so you'll always have the latest features.

These things take time, and how much is always really hard to say. Asking how long won't make it happen faster, but testing it and providing good bug reports might.

Why not follow the forum thread? You can subscribe to it using the Thread Tools menu near the top right. Then, you can get updates by e-mail or just here on the forum. You can also Follow the mod on Kerbal Stuff so you'll always have the latest features.

These things take time, and how much is always really hard to say. Asking how long won't make it happen faster, but testing it and providing good bug reports might.

Can you unsubscribe?
I don't really want to subscribe to it if I can't unsubscribe.

Of course.

You can unsubscribe two ways: in the thread, use the thread tools menu to unsubscribe; in your subscriptions folder, check the checkbox next to that thread and then go to Select Threads > Delete Subscription > Go.

Of course.

You can unsubscribe two ways: in the thread, use the thread tools menu to unsubscribe; in your subscriptions folder, check the checkbox next to that thread and then go to Select Threads > Delete Subscription > Go.

Thanks, but, I'll just wait.
i may be able to help you out with this one, i'm gonna see if i can implement it in the new AVP, i would like to add rain and lighting/storms
